item.title: Soiled Nappies, Electrical goods, Trash, 7th July
item.description:
This pathway, that my children walk down daily to school is disgusting. It's been littered with soiled nappies and trash for weeks now, spread all across the path. Electrical items have been smashed and discarded everywhere. Beer cans, glass bottles, etc. It's a health hazard and getting worse each day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach Path, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Outside number 7 and 8, 7th July
item.description:
The drain is blocked as pedestrians throw litter, the drain gets flooded. Outside the restaurant, when it rains it gets worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Leigh Street, King's Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins, 7th July
item.description:
From the Enderby pub to the Anchor and Hope pub, the Thames path is in a terrible state with bins overflowing and rats and mice feasting on the waste. It's a serious health concern. In some places the rubbish is blocking the path meaning it's inaccessible for wheelchair users and others with mobility issues. The path needs regular collections especially over summer when it is used more..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Morden Wharf Road, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ?burst water main, 7th July
item.description:
Since this morning water is coming up from the paving cracks in the pavement, running down the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24,24A, Maylands Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wood bollards broken and left on green verge, 7th July
item.description:
Could you please replace the wooden bollards on the green verge? It appears they have been damaged, possibly by a vehicle reversing into them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Increase in dog fouling chatterton road, 7th July
item.description:
There are NO SIGNS warning dog owners at all in the village. There has been a signifcant increase in dog mess. Other residential areas in Bromley all have signage warning of cosequences...there are none in Chatterton Village. Can we have signage please ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pope Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
